definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
important/vital/to want/to ask for/will/going to (as future auxiliary)/may/must/(used in a comparison) must be/probably/if

sentences.english: Fear and procrastination are major enemies to success.
sentences.chinese: 恐懼和拖沓是成功的兩大要敵。

sentences.english: I couldnt understand a single word. … Youcould have been singing in Norwegian.
sentences.chinese: 我一個字也聽不懂，你大要在用挪威語演唱吧。

sentences.english: Well; I guess shewouls trying to play hard-to-get.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，大要想跟我玩“養虎遺患”的遊戲吧。

definition: then/at once/always/(archaic) luggage rack on a chariot
to be too petty or insignificant to mention/to not be worth mentioning (idiom)
to carry out a task personally/to take responsibility for
equally true for (all the rest)/the same thing applies (for everyone)
see 矯枉過正|矫枉过正[jiao3 wang3 guo4 zheng4]
lit. to prescribe the right medicine for an illness (idiom); fig. to study a problem to find the right way to solve it/to take appropriate steps
